text: Nandod () is one of the 182 constituencies of the Gujarat Legislative Assembly. ==Creation== The seat came into existence in 2008, after the delimitation exercise in which constituency boundaries were redrawn. The Nandod assembly constituency is a part of the Chhota Udaipur (Lok Sabha constituency). The seat is reserved for members of Scheduled Tribes. Nandod is a town located in Narmada district of Gujarat. ==Segments== This assembly seat represents the following segments #Nandod Taluka – entire taluka except Dhefa village #Tilakwada Taluka ==Number of voters== {| class=wikitable style=text- align:right |- !Election !Men !Women !Others !Total |- |align=left|2012||105,338||97,449||0||202,787 |- |align=left colspan=6|Source: Chief Electoral Officer |} ==Members of Legislative Assembly== {| class=wikitable !Term !Member !Party |- |2012–2017||Shabdarshan Tadvi||Bharatiya Janata Party |- |2017–||Premsinhbhai Devjibhai Vasava||Indian National Congress |} ==Election results== ===2012=== Gujarat Assembly Elections - 2012: Statistical Report Chief Electoral Officer ==See also== *List of constituencies of Gujarat Legislative Assembly *Gujarat Legislative Assembly ==References== Category:Assembly constituencies of Gujarat Category:Narmada district
title: Nandod
